channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Neural implant lets paralyzed person type by imagining writing
item.description: A paralyzed individual hit 90 characters per minute, 99% accuracy.

item.title: $50 monthly broadband discounts available starting today via 825 ISPs
item.description: FCC’s emergency pandemic fund is open, with 825 home and mobile ISPs participating.

item.title: Snap cuts off Yolo, LMK anonymous messaging apps after lawsuit over teen’s death
item.description: Lawsuit alleges messaging apps were “dangerous and defective.”

item.title: Valve’s Gabe Newell hints at vague console plans coming “this year”
item.description: Indefinite tease comes during Q�A with New Zealand students.

item.title: The best smartwatches for every type of user
item.description: We looked at smartwatches from every stripe, shape, and price point to find the best ones for your needs.

item.title: J&J vaccine supply has run out; Emergent says it’s working on improvements
item.description: Vaccine production at Emergent’s facility is still halted.

item.title: Volvo and Daimler bet on hydrogen truck boom this decade
item.description: Swedish and German groups expect fuel to challenge diesel in long-distance freight.

item.title: Aston Martin’s new boss tells us about the future of the company
item.description: Former AMG CEO Tobias Moers is now in charge of the British carmaker.

item.title: Famed Arthurian tale comes to silver screen in The Green Knight trailer
item.description: “Honor. That is why a knight does what he does.”

item.title: Rare fungal infections that destroy eyeballs and kill are on the rise in India
item.description: People with diabetes are particularly vulnerable to the aggressive fungus.

item.title: Ransomware crooks post cops’ psych evaluations after talks with DC police stall
item.description: Babuk demands $4 million, Metropolitan Police Department offers $100,000.

item.title: Nvidia’s RTX 3050 brings ray tracing and DLSS to $800 laptops
item.description: Performance-boosting DLSS on entry-level laptops could be a big deal.

item.title: Github reverses takedown of reverse-engineered GTA source code
item.description: Identical fork is restored after DMCA counterclaim.

item.title: Intel claims its new Tiger Lake-H CPUs for laptops beat AMD’s Ryzen 5000
item.description: Flagship Core i9-11980HK allegedly beats Ryzen 9 5900HX by 11 to 26 percent.

item.title: Our fave gentleman thief is back for revenge in trailer for Lupin part 2
item.description: Viewers frustrated by part 1’s maddening cliffhanger won’t have much longer to wait.

item.title: Baltimore chief prosecutor asks FCC to stop negative news coverage about her
item.description: First Amendment prevents FCC from punishing news station for its “tone.”

item.title: Apple’s MagSafe wireless charger is on sale for a new low price today
item.description: Dealmaster also has wireless headphones, Switch gear, and gaming monitors.

item.title: After many delays, Massachusetts’ Vineyard Wind is finally approved
item.description: The new project will be over 20 times larger than anything built in the US.

item.title: Samsung and AMD will reportedly take on Apple’s M1 SoC later this year
item.description: Exynos with an AMD GPU is coming for laptops, but maybe not phones?

item.title: Programming a robot to teach itself how to move
item.description: Flexible, open-ended learning software works but finds the real world difficult.

item.title: HTC’s newest headsets signal end of Vive’s 5-year “VR for the home” mission
item.description: Vive Focus 3 is a $1,299, enterprise-grade answer to Oculus Quest 2, plus Vive Pro 2.

item.title: Amazon and others ordered to slash diesel pollution from warehouse trucks
item.description: Southern California is being smothered by pollution from e-commerce warehouses.

item.title: Fatal Tesla Model S crash unlikely to involve Autopilot, according to NTSB
item.description: Was the person found in the back of the car trying to manually release the door?

item.title: A new book, Amazon Unbound, reveals Jeff Bezos’ envy of SpaceX
item.description: Bezos tried to hire Gwynne Shotwell to run Blue Origin in 2016.

item.title: FDA authorizes Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine for 12- to 15-year-olds
item.description: The CDC’s advisory committee will meet Wednesday to vote on recommending use.

item.title: Apple invests $45 million more in Gorilla Glass-maker Corning
item.description: Investment follows millions more that produced the iPhone 12’s ceramic shield.

item.title: Amazon “seized and destroyed” 2 million counterfeit products in 2020
item.description: Counterfeit products sent to Amazon warehouses are destroyed to prevent resale.

item.title: It’s the battle of the alien symbiotes in Venom: Let There Be Carnage trailer
item.description: “I’ve been thinking about you, Eddie, because you and I are the same.”

item.title: By eating them, hyenas gathered 9 Neanderthal skeletons in one cave
item.description: The Neanderthals appear to have met a very bad end.

item.title: Security researcher successfully jailbreaks an Apple AirTag
item.description: Successful jailbreak increases existing AirTag security and privacy concerns.

item.title: Google: We put YouTube TV in the main YouTube app. What now, Roku?
item.description: Google sidesteps the YouTube TV ban, threatens to send free devices to customers.

item.title: AstraZeneca’s troubled vaccine not renewed in EU; Pfizer gets big, new deal
item.description: Meanwhile, China’s Sinopharm vaccine—79% efficacy, easy to store—authorized by WHO.

item.title: Hackers who shut down pipeline: We don’t want to cause “problems for society”
item.description: The attack paralyzed a pipeline that moves 2.5 million barrels per day.

item.title: Private-equity firm revives zombie fossil-fuel power plant to mine bitcoin
item.description: Power plant was left for dead until the cryptocurrency boom came along.

item.title: Ford picks a name for its electric pickup truck: The F-150 Lightning
item.description: The SVT F-150 Lightning was a factory hot rod pickup in the 1990s.

item.title: Sony says PS5 could be difficult to find into 2022
item.description: Healthy demand, semiconductor shortage combine to keep the system hard to find.

item.title: Here’s our first look at 2023’s electric Porsche Macan SUV
item.description: The Macan will share an electric platform with Audi’s next A6 and Q6.

item.title: A SpaceX booster now trails only 4 space shuttles in flight experience
item.description: This particular first stage is approaching historic status.

item.title: Android Automotive OS review: Under the hood with Google’s car OS
item.description: AAOS nails the car platform fundamentals, but it needs more apps and features.

item.title: New book Press Reset investigates the high human cost of game development
item.description: Beloved game-industry journo aims his lens at the little people making big video games.

item.title: Why Amy Klobuchar just wrote 600 pages on antitrust
item.description: “Monopolies tend to have a lot of control, not just over consumers, but also over politics.”

item.title: Review: The role-playing game’s afoot in charming dark comedy Murder Bury Win
item.description: It’s not an instant classic like Clue, but it’s fun, very solid indie fare.

item.title: Rivian’s electric truck features include air compressor and AC outlets
item.description: It has storage compartments galore, plus an extending truck bed.

item.title: Apple brass discussed disclosing 128-million iPhone hack, then decided not to
item.description: Emails entered into Epic Games lawsuit show execs contradicting Apple talking points.

item.title: It began as an AI-fueled dungeon game. Then it got much darker
item.description: AI algorithm created disturbing stories, including sex scenes involving children.

item.title: Windows 10 “Sun Valley” will do away with Windows 95 era icons
item.description: The results are more subtle than you might expect from a 25+ year visual update.

item.title: Sony faces lawsuit over alleged “monopoly pricing” of PlayStation downloads
item.description: Proposed class action says Sony’s moves have increased prices for PlayStation games.

item.title: 96% of US users opt out of app tracking in iOS 14.5, analytics find
item.description: Some of the first data on user behavior exceeds advertisers' worst fears.

item.title: Ajit Pai promised cheaper Internet—real prices rose 19 percent instead
item.description: Home-Internet prices rose four times faster than inflation in Trump era.

item.title: Tesla Autopilot director contradicts Musk’s self-driving timeline
item.description: Musk described full autonomy as “basically a solved problem” in 2016.
